snippet: Senators voted to prohibit the government from imprisoning American citizens and green card holders apprehended in the United States in indefinite detention without trial.
abstract: Senate votes to prohibit government from imprisoning American citizens and green card holders apprehended in United States in indefinite detention without trial; move appears to bolster protections for domestic civil liberties, but it is opposed by rights groups who claim it implies that other types of people inside US could be placed in military detention.
lead_paragraph: Senators voted to prohibit the government from imprisoning American citizens and green card holders apprehended in the United States in indefinite detention without trial.

headline.main: Senate Votes to Curb Indefinite Detention
